channel.title: healthTest
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from healthTest, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ticks are migrating, but scant surveillance may leave doctors in the dark on patient treatment
item.description: Health departments struggle to adequately survey for ticks to warn doctors about new species and the diseases they carry.

item.title: Walmart recalls frozen shrimp over potential radioactive contamination
item.description: The risk from the recalled shrimp is "quite low," said Donald Schaffner, a food safety expert at Rutgers University. Cesium-137 is a byproduct of nucl...

item.title: A hurricane's effects on victims' health last for years after the storm, study finds
item.description: A new study shows that the effects hurricanes have on people's health can last for years after a storm passes.

item.title: These brain implants speak your mind — even when you don't want to
item.description: Brain-implanted devices that allow paralyzed people to speak can also decode words they imagine, but don't intend to share.

item.title: The joy of teaching medicine through life’s toughest challenges

item.title: Why health care can’t survive on no-fail missions alone

item.title: Study shows culture shapes shared mental health decision making
item.description: A new study has revealed that cultural background can influence how mental health care staff approach shared decision-making with patients.

item.title: Epigenetic Aging May Be A Biomarker for Respiratory Disease
item.description: A population-based NHANES survey showed accelerated markers of aging in adults with wheezing and emphysema. Medscape Medical News

item.title: Behavioral Activation Therapy Cuts Perinatal Suicide Risk
item.description: In perinatal adults, suicide ideation decreases 25% with each behavioral activation treatment session. Medscape Medical News
